title: CENTEGIX Safety Platform® Selected by Moore Public Schools to Champion Alyssa's Law and Protect Students, Staff, and Visitors
description: CENTEGIX Safety Platform® Selected by Moore Public Schools to Champion Alyssa's Law and Protect Students, Staff, and Visitors
content:
ATLANTA, Sept. 2, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- CENTEGIX® is honored to announce that Moore Public Schools (OK) has chosen to implement the full CENTEGIX Safety Platform®, including CrisisAlert™, Safety Blueprint®, and Enhanced Visitor Management. The district's selection underscores its commitment to championing Alyssa's Law and leading the way in strengthening safety and security across all campuses.

Moore Public Schools' decision to implement the CENTEGIX Safety Platform is part of a comprehensive strategy to increase safety for its students, staff, and community.

"Our responsibility is to ensure real safety, not just check a compliance box. During our evaluation, it became clear that a simple wearable wasn't enough. We chose CENTEGIX because they are the only solution that provides precise, room-level location data—which is critical for responders—and pairs it with visual strobes in every classroom and across campus."

"In a crisis, that visual alert cuts through the noise and ensures the message is received by everyone, instantly. That's a level of reliability and effectiveness we couldn't find anywhere else," said Moore Public Schools Director of Safety and Security Dustin Hortstkoetter . "As an Alyssa's Law-approved provider by the Oklahoma State Department of Education, CENTEGIX brings proven expertise as the leader in wearable panic buttons."

Why CENTEGIX is the best choice for Oklahoma School Districts

CrisisAlert equips every staff member with a wearable badge that empowers them to quickly and discreetly get help during emergencies ranging from medical situations to campus-wide threats. The badge is easy to use under stress and works indoors and outdoors. CrisisAlert provides responders with precise, room-level location details on dynamic digital maps and delivers critical alert information directly to 911. Full audio and visual notifications—flashing strobes, intercom announcements, and screen takeovers—instantly alert everyone to activate safety protocols. Strobes are an essential component and are included in every installation – in every room, hallway, and common area, providing an immediate visual notice of the emergency.

CENTEGIX Visitor Management empowers campuses to quickly and efficiently check in and authenticate visitors. Enhanced Visitor Management leverages a highly visible CENTEGIX visitor badge with built-in real-time locating capabilities so administrators can assign and locate volunteers, contractors, parents, and guests using a live campus map.

Safety Blueprint provides interactive, dynamic digital maps of each campus. Customers increasingly choose Safety Blueprint because:
• Customers own their mapping data. CENTEGIX has no licensing restrictions.
• Frictionless updates. Customers can update, print, export, and share maps anytime without additional cost, including with PSAP/911 agencies.
• Mapping data is dynamic, Not Static. When a change is made, updates are instantly published and available to all users of Safety Blueprint maps. There is no need to distribute printed maps or digital files.
• Maps Are an Integral Part of Real-Time Alerting via CrisisAlert. Maps are part of the emergency alert response that provides real-time map views, asset overlays, and location information. Mapping data is "served" to responders in real-time.

"Time is the single most critical factor in an emergency," said Brent Cobb, CEO of CENTEGIX . "With our Safety Platform, districts like Moore Public Schools (OK) can compress the response timeline so that help arrives as quickly as possible. Alyssa's Law underscores the importance of equipping schools with panic alert systems, and by also adopting Enhanced Visitor Management and Safety Blueprint, Moore is setting a new standard in comprehensive school safety."

Moore Public Schools joins a growing number of districts nationwide that trust CENTEGIX as the center of their layered school safety strategy.

For over 100 years, Moore Public Schools has remained a leader in academic excellence. As Oklahoma's fourth-largest public school district (FY26), we serve 22,700 students and their families within Moore and south Oklahoma City. Our vision is Shaping Today's Students Into Tomorrow's Leaders. Each year, we celebrate our National Merit Finalists and Scholars, academic all-state students, their innumerable scholarships and awards, and we compete for 6A athletics titles. Our superior fine arts, STEM, and career exploration options, coupled with our incredible staff, develop MPS students into young adults of character and resilience, prepared for life after graduation. Learn more at www.mooreschools.com .

Zero to Five

CENTEGIX® is the industry leader in wearable safety technology for schools and workplaces. The cloud-based CENTEGIX Safety Platform initiates the fastest response time for emergencies, from the everyday to the extreme, anywhere on campus. Leaders in over 15,000 locations nationwide trust CENTEGIX's innovative solutions to empower and protect their communities. Learn more at https://www.centegix.com/

The district's commitment to championing Alyssa's Law and strengthening safety and security across all campuses is part of a comprehensive strategy to increase safety for students, staff, and community. CENTEGix's Safety Platform provides precise, room-level location data and pairs it with visual strobes in every classroom and across campus. CrisisAlert provides responders with critical alert information directly to 911. shortSummary: Moore Public Schools will implement the CENTEGIX Safety Platform, including CrisisAlert, Safety Blueprint, and Visitor Management, to enhance safety and security across campuses.

scraped_sources.text:
In Emergency Response,
EVERY. SECOND. MATTERS.®
No confusion. No hesitation. Just life-saving action. It’s why more organizations nationwide trust our platform and the most-used wearable panic button to protect their people every day.
In an Emergency, EVERY. SECOND. MATTERS.®
You carry the weight of every second. We built the technology to help you carry it confidently. Our rapid response safety platform and solutions compress precious time in emergencies and empower your staff to act calmly, confidently, and clearly when it matters most.
No confusion. No hesitation. Just life-saving action. It’s why more organizations nationwide trust our platform and the most-used wearable panic button to protect their people every day.
15M+
people protected
700K+
alerts delivered
15K+
locations covered
Built by People Who’ve Been in Your Shoes
We understand the weight of protecting others—the students, the patients, the public—because we’ve been there. The pressure is constant and the stakes are high.
Our team includes former educators, law enforcement, and caregivers who’ve lived that urgency firsthand. That’s why we obsess over the critical seconds that define an emergency.
For every leader responsible for a campus, facility, or workplace, our Safety Platform is singularly focused on compressing your emergency response timeline. It leverages dynamic digital mapping, real-time locating capabilities, an easy-to-use wearable panic button, and visitor management and reunification capabilities to plan for and respond faster to any safety situation.
The ability to have that additional sense of safety and security… it gives our staff such a sense of safety, protection, and consideration.
Our District is adding a layer of safety with the CENTEGIX CrisisAlert wearable badge for Alyssa’s Law, gaining the on-site notifications—strobes, computer screen takeovers, intercom announcements—that initiate our emergency protocols and direct everyone on campus to follow their safety training.
Whether it is a whole campus situation—the unthinkable—or these different medical emergencies, I cannot think of anything that’s going to speed up a response the way the Safety Platform does, or enable as many employees to be able to get help and initiate a response.
I had a student have a diabetic seizure in my classroom today. Right in the middle of class he stood up, called my name… and seconds later he collapsed. It scared me to death.
It was only by the grace of God I was close enough when it happened to catch his head before it hit the ground. We both went down together, knocked over a table, shattered a coffee mug, and sent about 150 highlighters in a basket flying across the room. I’m sure my lack of grace was largely responsible for that part.
I don’t think I’ve prayed that hard in a long time. Kids were scared and crying. A few ran for help. It was terrifying.
The nurse was there within 2 minutes which was honestly incredible given the distance she had to run across campus to get to my room. Gadsden City is MASSIVE. I have no idea how she did it, but nurses are heroes and they always do.
Today I realized what a blessing the panic button on my Centegix badge truly is without it the response time would’ve probably doubled, if not tripled.
Just imagine if it had been worse. A press of that button instantly notifies administration, campus police, and the nurse that there’s an emergency. It tracks the location of the person who’s wearing it in live time and within two minutes I had an administrator, two police officers, and a nurse at my door. TWO minutes. 120 SECONDS.
THAT is how you spend money to protect and support teachers and students and today I’m very thankful to be in a place that prioritizes safety over everything else.
Workplace safety [is the] number one issue not only for the schools but also throughout the nation, so this gives an extra level of security for our staff members.
Different Missions. One Goal: Safety Without Delay
Healthcare
Empower healthcare workers to get help during instances of workplace violence and other emergencies, anywhere on campus.
Government
Keep public servants and staff safe where they do critical work on behalf of constituents and communities.
Higher Education
Technology to create a safe campus culture for your trade school, college or university.
Commercial
Easy-to-use safety solutions create safer workplaces by protecting all employees, customer-facing and behind the scenes.
Solutions Powered by the Safety Platform
Empower your staff to get help instantly anywhere on your campus with a push of a button–giving them, and you, critical peace of mind. Ninety-eight percent of CrisisAlert users feel safer and more supported at work.
Seconds save lives. Use digital critical incident maps you control to direct responders to an emergency with precision, down to the floor and room level. You own your maps and can update them anytime. Adding safety assets to your maps provides everyone from your facility manager to first responders with the location of the nearest AEDs, video cameras, bleed control and first aid.
When seconds matter, location-aware video gives you the power to act with clarity and confidence. The moment a CrisisAlert badge activates an alert, live feeds from the nearest cameras put you inside the scene, so your team arrives prepared, informed, and ready to protect what matters most.
No longer worry if unauthorized personnel are on your campus. Efficiently authenticate, manage, and locate visitors on your campus with versatile check-in options, comprehensive visitor screening, real-time visitor locating, and discreet issue detection and notification to keep schools, facilities, and workplaces safe.

Empowering Staff to Act and Respond In Critical Moments
98%
of CrisisAlert usage helps staff with everyday emergencies
700K+
CrisisAlert badge users
98%
say CrisisAlert helps them feel safe and supported
Cultivate a Culture of Safety
Putting time on your side is critical in an emergency, but as a leader, you know safety starts long before the emergency, and you can’t do it alone. It takes a unified team to turn a safety plan into a safety culture.
That’s where our Safety Platform becomes your essential solution. It equips everyone with a simple, consistent way to act and respond to an emergency—from an everyday incident to an extreme crisis. The result is a proactive culture of safety, where your people are empowered to act and respond with confidence, clarity, and calm in the seconds that matter most.
Why Leaders Trust CENTEGIX
CrisisAlert is the solution we’ve been looking for. Knowing that in healthcare, if there’s a problem, you just hit that badge…This is an outstanding solution to a long-standing problem.
The immediate response is something I love…it’s not even a second after I hit my button. It’s that comfort and reassurance that my team is here for me and will help protect me and the clinic.
When we evaluated dozens of solutions to comply with the panic button mandates in different states, we were impressed with CENTEGIX’s unique ability to cover every square foot of a property. That—along with the ease of installation and their responsive approach to customer support—led to our decision that CENTEGIX is the best solution for our properties.
The idea that anybody can call a lockdown is huge. And not only that, 911 is notified immediately, and they know who activated the lockdown and where they were located…That’s good knowledge, especially for law enforcement.
Safety and security is everyone’s responsibility, so if we’re going to make that everyone’s responsibility, then everyone needs to be empowered to have a voice. These are public schools and parents entrust their children to us every day.
Our previous mobile app didn’t work because there were simply too many places on campus where the service was unavailable. We switched to CENTEGIX because there was nothing else that compared in terms of complete campus coverage and ease of use.
The Award-Winning Trusted Safety Partner for
Thousands of Organizations Nationwide
Ready to Transform Your Emergency Response?

argos_summary: Moore Public Schools in Oklahoma has chosen CENTEGIX’s full Safety Platform—CrisisAlert, Safety Blueprint, and Enhanced Visitor Management—to meet Alyssa’s Law requirements and enhance campus safety. The platform offers room‑level location tracking, real‑time alerts, and dynamic digital maps to accelerate emergency response. By adopting these tools, the district aims to reduce response times and provide comprehensive protection for students, staff, and visitors.
